ai-mil3.2.2:1.2_0: “Venerable Sir, he who doesn’t know whether he is enjoying them, he who thinks, ‘I will enjoy profit.’”
ai-mil3.2.2:1.3_0: “Yes, great king, he who doesn’t know, ‘I will enjoy.’”
ai-mil3.2.2:1.5_0: “The cause, great king, what is the reason for you know, ‘I shall give you out of this.’”
ai-mil3.2.2:2.2_0: “It would be good, great king, if the householder Kaṇṭaka had stayed in the forest groves and then fill it,
ai-mil3.2.2:2.3_0: But after some time they couldn’t eat it or enjoy it, or make it clear. They’d eat the money, so I’d better preemptively rouse up energy for myself, or find out that he’s clear.”
ai-mil3.2.2:2.6_0: “Whatever is the cause, what is the reason for this?”
ai-mil3.2.2:2.7_0: “In the same way, the cause, great king, what is the reason for you know, ‘I shall give you a reason for you.’”
